## Calculating Beta Using Covariance and Market Variance ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} set.seed(202) #| eval: true #| echo: false #| results: asis #| warning: false library(webexercises) cov_am <- rnorm(1, mean = 4, sd = 1) var_mkt <- rnorm(1, mean = 5, sd = 1) beta_val <- cov_am / var_mkt ``` ::: Given that the covariance between a stock and the market is **2.87** and the variance of the market is **4.56**, ::: {.question-block}
âœ… Beta = Cov(asset, market) / Var(market) = **0.63**.
:::
